title.rendered: 5 Rules for Designing a Timeless Kitchen

content.rendered:
It’s almost that time of year—home improvement time! Whether you are building a kitchen from scratch or renovating a fix and flip, it’s important to make sure the kitchen you build is timeless.

Many popular home improvement shows love to display beautiful renovated kitchens with sleek appliances, modern flares, and bright accents. Although these trendy kitchens get us excited about our own kitchen renovation possibilities, it’s important to think about what will always be “in”. Designing a timeless kitchen will not only bring lasting beauty to your space, but it will also save you from constant renovation projects.

Creating a timeless kitchen is actually quite easy—here are a few tips to help you get started.

1. Neutral Colors

Even though orange accents are popular right now, will they still be popular in 10 or 20 years? You might love a certain color or style right now, but just like everything else, kitchen design trends are constantly changing.

Using neutral colors will ensure a classic and finished look—grays, whites, browns, and blacks are all colors that will always stay in style. However, this doesn’t mean you can’t put a personal touch in your new kitchen with your favorite color trends. Accent the space with fun area rugs, backsplash, tablecloths/table runners, curtains, flower arrangements, and other decor.

2. Stone Countertops

Stone countertops are one kitchen trend that you can always expect to be in style. Quartz and granite countertops are durable and easy to clean while giving a constant sparkle to your kitchen. No matter what colors you like, a neutral stone countertop will match your kitchen design and style as an attractive center of attention for years to come.

3. Subway Tile

Another timeless kitchen tradition is subway tile—it’s affordable, beautiful, and classic. Subway tile can add some personality to your kitchen while giving it a clean and finished look. Whether you use it as an accent wall or backsplash, subway tile is a great decorative addition to any kitchen.

4. Shaker Style Cabinets

One of the biggest benefits of using shaker style cabinets in your kitchen is that they are affordable and versatile. Shaker style cabinets are easy to construct and repair, which means that you won’t break the bank if a cabinet breaks. Plus, their sleek and decorative look will match any type of kitchen from modern to traditional!

5. Glass Cabinet Doors

Although we love shaker style cabinets, let’s not forget about our other favorite—glass cabinet doors. Glass cabinet doors are an easy way to store glassware and brighten up your kitchen by showing off those beautiful serving platters and wedding china. Combined with the right lighting, glass cabinet doors create the illusion of a bigger space and openness, which is great for small condo or apartment kitchens in .

Don’t Forget the Details

Choosing the right cabinets and countertops for a timeless kitchen are important, but don’t forget other important details when designing your kitchen. Remember to install high-quality appliances that with beauty and durability, as well as adequate overhead lighting that will provide visibility while cooking and compliment the space.

Another mark of a great kitchen is openness and organization—these two aspects never go out of style and are often a priority to home buyers when looking for the perfect kitchen. A great way to add value to your kitchen is by adding an island for extra workspace and installing wall shelves and drawer organizers.

Create a Timeless Kitchen With Your Local Kitchen Experts at NEBS

Now that you know how to design a timeless kitchen, it’s time to build it! At NEBS, we help residential contractors and homeowners pick out the perfect additions for all your kitchen needs.

Our kitchen experts can show you a variety of countertops and cabinets for your kitchen project. Stop by our showroom or give us a call today to begin building your timeless kitchen with NEBS!
